content.description:
A personal favorite. Perfect hands to fist crack. At the crack's high point, step up and right and move 20' across (mostly) unprotectable face to belay from Pinyon pine. A small stopper placement early in the traverse helps to protect both leader and follower.

Approach: From Barker Dam parking lot, follow trail to dam and continue north through wash. Bear northwest (left) past Escape Rock. The Room To Shroom formation will be on your right, but hidden until you pass it and look back. Scramble up rocks to get to base of route.

Descent: Single rope rappel to ground from bolted anchor.
content.protection: Bring pro to 3". A small stopper helps protect the final 20' traverse.

content.description: Toprope the blunt arete just right of the start of Room To Shroom.
content.protection: Pro to 3 inches to rig a toprope

climbs.name: Mud Dog
climbs.fa: Craig Fry, Jerelyn Taubert, Cathy Boyd and Jim Angione, November 1985

content.description:
Not a great route, but not a complete waste of time either. The line is on the S. Face of the Room To Shroom rock and may be a diversion to climb prior to the sun hitting the W. Face and the main attractions here.

Climb up to reach a crack that becomes a shallow left-facing corner and follow it to the standard rap station. Alternatively, the route may also be a quick TR after doing one of the more popular routes. This line does have a little scaly rock, but it's not as bad as the name might imply.

The route is visible as the shaded corner on the right-hand side of the rock in the attached picture, but this shot, although showing the line, does little to describe it.

climbs.name: Fool's Cold (aka Shoeless Joe Jackson)
climbs.fa: (TR) Rex Pieper, Keath Nupuf, Jeffrey Thomas, February 1995, FL: Todd Gordon & Dana Adler

content.description: This is the rappel line off of the Room to Shroom formation. Ascend a face to a large quartzite/fool's gold intrusion. Climb either left, right or straight past this then continue to the top, avoiding the crack of Mud Dog.
content.location:
Around and right of

Room To Shroom

.

climbs.name: Chemical Warfare
climbs.fa: Drew Bedford, George Zamelis and Skunk - March 1983

content.description: Refer to Room To Shroom description for approach information.  Start 50' uphill (left) of 'Shroom.  Gain finger/hand crack by bouldering up 8' (poor landing - ankle breaker).  Move right along finger crack and finish as for Room To Shroom.  Descend as for 'Shroom.
content.protection: Pro to 2_ (.75 size helpful).  A small stopper helps to protect both leader and follower on the final 20' traverse.

content.description: Toprope the face between Room To Shroom and Chemical Warfare.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches to rig a toprope
